column1: PT-STRESS-01 OC-ST-01 "Stress " "Identify the system's maximum sustainable capacity under a controlled 12-step stress ramp (25 concurrent users every 60 seconds) up to 300 users
column2: and determine the SLA breach point using AutoStop thresholds. " "Apache JMeter 5.6.3" "OpenCart_E2E_FullFlow.jmx " "0 ? 300 " "12-step ramp (720 sec)
column4: 730 MB - Pages/sec: 20.44 " "1.459% disk time (Queue length: 0.015; Writes/sec: 4.467) " "Light traffic (157 KB/s received
column5: 2.10 KB/s sent) " Fail "The system showed consistent performance degradation at 150-175 concurrent users

column1: PT-SCALE-01 OC-SC-01 "Scalability " "Assess system scalability by comparing baseline performance on the local XAMPP environment with the expected behaviour of a scaled infrastructure capable of sustaining 500 concurrent users during a 30-minute steady-state load
column5: and resource utilisation. " "Apache JMeter 5.6.3" OpenCart_E2E_FullFlow.jmx 500 "500-user steady load (30 min baseline
column6: 30 min scaled) " "3 s" 1.00% 0.00% "Not Executed - Environment Limitation " N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A N/A "Not Executed " "The 500-user
column7: 30-minute scalability scenario exceeds the capabilities of the local XAMPP stack (Apache/PHP/MySQL)
column8: which cannot support the required concurrency due to prefork worker limitations
column10: and insufficient database throughput. This scenario is design-only and requires a scaled multi-node or cloud-based infrastructure for meaningful execution. "

column6: and resource utilisation compared with a single-node baseline. The local XAMPP environment cannot execute this test due to the absence of load-balancing infrastructure
column8: and the limited concurrency capacity of a single-node Apache/PHP/MySQL setup. "
